newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel detains Iraqi infiltrator at Jordan border.
newsitem.headline: Israel detains Iraqi infiltrator at Jordan border.

text.p: The Israeli army on Sunday detained an Iraqi citizen who attempted to infiltrate from Jordan, Israeli security sources said.
They said a 35-year-old Iraqi had crossed into Israel near Bet Shean on the border with Jordan north of the West Bank. They said he was apparently unarmed and was detained for questioning.
In the past Iraqis have crossed into Israel from Jordan seeking work or political asylum.
Jordan, which cooperated quietly with Israel even when the two states were officially enemies, has kept tight control of the border since it signed a peace treaty with the Jewish state in 1994.
